bibl.title: The ""Corpus of Ptolemaic Inscriptions from Egypt"" Project: Unpublished Texts.
bibl.note: 1. Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, Inv. G 1205. Dedication by Alexander the Great? Memphis, late fourth century. - 2. Egyptian Museum, Cairo, Inv. JdE 89049. Dedication on behalf of Ptolemy VIII, Kleopatra II and Kleopatra III. Euhemeria, 128/7-116 BCE. - 3. Egyptian Museum, Cairo, Inv JdProv. 29/12/14/2. Dedication on behalf of Ptolemy III, Berenike and their children. Saqqara. - 4. Egyptian Museum, Cairo, Inv JdProv. 29/12/14/3. Dedication to Dionysos, Neilos and Arsinoe. Saqqara?, reign of Ptolemy IV Philopator and Arsinoe III. - 5. Location unknown (text studied from a photograph kept in the E. Bernand archive). Dedication to Ptolemy V, Kleopatra I and the Saviour Gods. Provenance unknown. - 6. Location unknown (text studied from a photograph kept in the E. Bernand archive). Inscription from Siwa.
bibl.seg: Alan Bowman, Charles Crowther & Kyriakos Savvopoulos, The ""Corpus of Ptolemaic Inscriptions from Egypt"" Project: Unpublished Texts.
